Judul: DRUG USE EVALUATION OF URINARY TRACT INFECTIONS AMONG INPATIENTS IN A PRIVATE HOSPITAL IN BANDUNG
Abstrak: Background and Objectives: Urinary tract infections (UTIs) are one of the most common infections that infected the population thus the use of antibiotics as therapy is frequent and sometimes leads to inappropriate use. In order to ensure optimal quality of therapy, drug use evaluation is needed. The research was done to establish a drug use criteria as guidelines for appropriate antibiotic use for the treatment of UTIs. Besides that, this research also helps to ensure the quality of treatment and promotes better understanding about the therapy in the future. Methods and Material: A retrospective study was conducted by reviewing medical records available in a period of two years from January 2010 until December 2011 at the one of private hospital in Bandung. The data gathered was then evaluated based on the drug use criteria established from recognize literature. Results: The total inpatients of UTIs were 70 patients. The result showed that antibiotics indicated for UTIs were 100% appropriate, 15 patients (21.43%) received inappropriate dose, 32 patients (45.7%) received inappropriate length of antibiotic therapy, 3 patients showed the possible drug-drug interactions, but not clinically significant. Based on the outcome of therapy, 64 patients (91.42%) were declared cured, 5 patients (7.15%) not cured and one patient (1.43%) force leaved the hospital. Conclusion: This study showed that the antibiotic treatment of UTI is appropriately indicated but still have inappropriate dosing of antibiotic and length of treatment according to established guidelines.
